Package tan.jerry.process_future_movement.service

Class ProcessFutureMovementMapReduceTaskletProcessor

java.lang.Object
tan.jerry.process_future_movement.service.ProcessFutureMovementMapReduceTaskletProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProcessFutureMovementService
public class ProcessFutureMovementMapReduceTaskletProcessor extends Object implements ProcessFutureMovementService
ProcessFutureMovementMapReduceTaskletProcessor uses a MapReduce-like approach to parallelize the processing of InputRecord objects into OutputRecord objects.

    • getClientInformation

      private String getClientInformation(InputRecord record)
      Constructs a client information string from an InputRecord.
      Parameters:
      record - The InputRecord containing client data.
      Returns:
      A string combining client type, client number, account number, and subaccount number.

    • getProductInformation

      private String getProductInformation(InputRecord record)
      Constructs a product information string from an InputRecord.
      Parameters:
      record - The InputRecord containing product data.
      Returns:
      A string combining exchange code, product group code, symbol, and expiration date.

    • calculateTransactionAmount

      private double calculateTransactionAmount(InputRecord record)
      Calculates the total transaction amount based on the quantities and their signs from an InputRecord. This method considers the `ignoreSignIndicators` configuration from BatchJobConfig.
      Parameters:
      record - The InputRecord containing quantity and sign information.
      Returns:
      The calculated total transaction amount.

    • process

      public Map<String,Double> process(Map<String,Double> expectedResults)
      Description copied from interface: ProcessFutureMovementService
      Processes the input map containing client-product transaction data and performs the necessary calculations or transformations. The default implementation simply returns the input map unchanged, but implementing classes will override this method with specific logic tailored to their processing approach.
      Specified by:
      process in interface ProcessFutureMovementService
      Parameters:
      expectedResults - A map containing client-product keys and corresponding transaction amounts.
      Returns:
      A map with processed transaction data, which may involve aggregation, filtering, or other transformations depending on the implementation.
